question: What are the names of disaster projects advertised before 2023
evidence_answer: Clover Heights Storm Drain, Guardrail Replacement Citywide, Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements
searched_docs:
Page 5 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A. Disaster Projects (Not Started)
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a few
storm drains on Clover Heights.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Unknown

Disaster Projects (Construction)
None at this time

Disaster Projects (Completed)
Guardrail Replacement Citywide (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged

guardrail throughout the City as a result of the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:131) Complete Design: Fall 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA after the
Wooley Fire.

Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing a portion of Corral

Canyon Road that was damaged from a failed storm drain.

Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged existing
fencing and repairing the damaged embankment adjacent to the bridge.

on Latigo Canyon Road located approximately 2,500 feet from PCH that was
damaged by the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Winter 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Spring 2022

Encinal Canyon Road Drainage Improvements (CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing damage storm drain
facilities and roadway embankments that were damaged by the Woolsey Fire.

Guardrail Replacement Citywide (FEMA Project)

is finalizing the bid documents. (cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:190) Updates:

The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop a plan that
includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations.

The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

Malibu Road Slope Repairs

(cid:190) Project Description: The existing slope adjacent to the beach access stairs
at 24712 Malibu Road has been eroded and caused damage to Malibu Road.

During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.

An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue. (cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces located
adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area.
(cid:190) Updates: Council approved an agreement in December for design services.

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer/Fall 2021

Drainage Improvements project and updates will be provided under
that project.
